fields.title: Django Admin Overview
fields.content:
## Django Admin

The Django Admin provides direct database access for system configuration.

### Available Sections

- **AI** - Configure AI prompts and coaching styles
- **Core** - Site configuration, themes, and choice options
- **Help** - Manage help topics for users and admins
- **Users** - User account management
- **Content Models** - Journal, Faith, Health, etc.

### Common Tasks

1. **Edit Site Settings** - Core → Site Configuration
2. **Modify AI Prompts** - AI → AI Prompt Configs
3. **Add Coaching Styles** - AI → Coaching Styles
4. **Manage Themes** - Core → Themes

### Back to Admin Console

Click **"Back to Admin Console"** in the header to return to the user-friendly admin interface.

fields.title: Configuring AI Prompts
fields.description: Customize how AI generates content throughout the app.
fields.content:
## AI Prompt Configuration

AI Prompt Configs control how the AI generates content for different features.

### Prompt Types

1. **daily_insight** - Dashboard daily insights
2. **weekly_summary** - Weekly reflection summaries
3. **journal_reflection** - Journal entry reflections
4. **prayer_encouragement** - Faith module encouragements
5. **goal_motivation** - Purpose module motivational messages
6. **health_insight** - Health tracking insights
7. **gratitude_prompt** - Gratitude prompts
8. **celebration** - Achievement celebrations
9. **accountability** - Gentle accountability nudges
10. **scripture_reflection** - Scripture reflection prompts

### Editing a Prompt

1. Click on the prompt type you want to edit.
2. Modify the **System Prompt** to change AI behavior.
3. Adjust **Max Tokens** to control response length.
4. Set **Sentence Count** for approximate response size.
5. Add **Tone Guidance** for style adjustments.
6. List **Things to Avoid** to prevent unwanted content.
7. Click **Save**.

### Testing Changes

After saving, test the prompt by using the relevant feature in the app.

fields.title: Managing Coaching Styles
fields.description: Configure AI personality options for users.
fields.content:
## Coaching Styles

Coaching Styles define the AI's personality when communicating with users.

### Default Styles

1. **Supportive Partner** - Warm, encouraging, celebrates wins
2. **Direct Coach** - Clear, action-focused, no fluff
3. **Gentle Guide** - Soft, patient, nurturing
4. **Tough Love** - Honest, challenging, pushes boundaries
5. **Wise Mentor** - Thoughtful, asks questions, shares wisdom
6. **Cheerleader** - High energy, enthusiastic, motivating
7. **Calm Advisor** - Measured, balanced, grounded

### Adding a New Style

1. Click **"Add Coaching Style"** in the top-right.
2. Enter a **Name** (displayed to users).
3. Enter a **Slug** (unique identifier, lowercase with dashes).
4. Write a **Description** (shown in preferences).
5. Write **Prompt Instructions** (guides AI behavior).
6. Choose an **Icon** (emoji or icon class).
7. Set **Sort Order** for display position.
8. Check **Is Active** to make it available.
9. Click **Save**.

### Editing Prompt Instructions

The prompt instructions are appended to all AI requests when a user selects that style. Write clear personality guidelines.

fields.title: Site Configuration
fields.content:
## Site Configuration

The Site Configuration model is a singleton—only one instance exists.

### Branding Settings

- **Site Name** - Displayed in browser title and headers
- **Tagline** - Shown on landing page
- **Logo** - Upload a custom logo (200x64 recommended)
- **Favicon** - Upload a favicon (32x32 PNG)

### Feature Toggles

- **Allow Registration** - Enable/disable new user signups
- **Require Email Verification** - Force email confirmation
- **Faith Enabled by Default** - Default for new users

### Theme Settings

- **Default Theme** - Theme assigned to new users

### Footer & Legal

- **Footer Text** - Copyright text
- **Privacy Policy URL** - Link to privacy policy
- **Terms URL** - Link to terms of service

### Saving Changes

After making changes, click **Save**. Changes take effect immediately but may be cached for up to 1 hour.

fields.title: Managing Themes
fields.content:
## Theme Management

Themes control the app's visual appearance with customizable colors.

### Theme Properties

- **Slug** - Unique identifier (e.g., 'minimal')
- **Name** - Display name
- **Description** - Brief description of the theme's feel

### Color Settings

Each theme has light and dark mode colors:

**Light Mode:**
- Primary, Secondary, Accent colors
- Text, Text Muted colors
- Background, Surface, Border colors

**Dark Mode:**
- Same properties with 'dark_' prefix

### Creating a Theme

1. Click **"Add Theme"**.
2. Enter slug, name, and description.
3. Set all color values (hex format, e.g., #6366f1).
4. Set sort order.
5. Check **Is Active** to make available.
6. Check **Is Default** if this should be the default.
7. Click **Save**.

### Color Picker Tips

- Use consistent color families
- Ensure text colors have good contrast
- Test in both light and dark contexts

fields.title: Managing User Help Topics
fields.description: Create and edit help content for users.
fields.content:
## User Help Topics

Help Topics provide context-aware assistance to users.

### How It Works

1. Each page has a **HELP_CONTEXT_ID** (e.g., DASHBOARD_HOME).
2. When users click the **?** button, the system fetches the matching help topic.
3. Help content is displayed in a modal.

### Creating a Help Topic

1. Click **"Add Help Topic"**.
2. Enter **Context ID** - Must match the template's HELP_CONTEXT_ID exactly.
3. Enter **Help ID** - URL-friendly slug.
4. Write a clear **Title**.
5. Write a brief **Description**.
6. Write detailed **Content** using Markdown formatting.
7. Set the **App Name** for organization.
8. Set **Order** for sorting within the app.
9. Click **Save**.

### Markdown Formatting

Content supports Markdown:
- `## Heading` for headers
- `**bold**` for emphasis
- `1. Item` for numbered lists
- `- Item` for bullet lists
- `` `code` `` for inline code

### Related Topics

Link related help topics so users can explore further.

fields.title: General Admin Help
fields.description: Basic help for Django admin pages.
fields.content:
## Django Admin Help

This is the Django Admin interface for Whole Life Journey.

### Navigation

- Use the sidebar to navigate between sections.
- Click on any model name to view its records.
- Click **"Add"** buttons to create new records.

### Common Actions

- **Search** - Use the search box to find records.
- **Filter** - Use sidebar filters to narrow results.
- **Bulk Actions** - Select records and use the action dropdown.
- **Export** - Some models support data export.

### Need More Help?

For specific help on a section, navigate to that section and click the **?** button again.

### Admin Console

For a more user-friendly admin experience, click **"Back to Admin Console"** in the header.

fields.title: Admin Console Overview
fields.content:
## Admin Console

The Admin Console provides a user-friendly interface for managing site settings and projects.

### Available Sections

- **Site Configuration** - Branding, feature toggles, and legal settings
- **Themes** - Manage visual themes for users
- **Projects** - Manage development projects and tasks
- **Task Intake** - Create new tasks for Claude or human completion
- **User Management** - View and manage user accounts

### Navigation

Use the cards on the dashboard to access different sections. Each card shows the current count of records.

### Django Admin Access

Click **"Django Admin"** in the header for direct database access and advanced configuration options.

fields.title: Managing Projects
fields.content:
## Projects

Projects organize related tasks for development work. Each project contains tasks that can be assigned to phases.

### Project Status

- **Open** - Active project with ongoing tasks
- **Complete** - All tasks finished, project closed

### Creating a Project

1. Click **"New Project"** button.
2. Enter a descriptive **Name**.
3. Add a **Description** explaining the project's purpose.
4. Set the initial **Status** (usually 'open').
5. Click **Save**.

### Project Details

Click on a project name to see:
- Project information and status
- All tasks grouped by phase
- Progress overview (completed vs total tasks)

### Managing Tasks

From the project detail page, you can:
- View task status and priority
- Click on tasks to edit them
- Track progress across phases

fields.title: Project Detail View
fields.content:
## Project Detail

This page shows all tasks for a specific project, organized by phase.

### Task Organization

Tasks are grouped by their assigned phase:
- **Phase 1** tasks appear first
- Within each phase, tasks are sorted by priority then creation date

### Task Status Colors

- **Backlog** - Gray, not yet ready for work
- **Ready** - Blue, available for Claude to execute
- **In Progress** - Yellow, currently being worked on
- **Done** - Green, completed successfully
- **Blocked** - Red, waiting on something

### Quick Actions

- Click a task title to view/edit details
- Use the task list filters to narrow the view

### Progress Tracking

The header shows completion progress:
- Total tasks in the project
- Completed tasks count
- Percentage complete

fields.title: Task List
fields.content:
## Task List

This page shows all tasks across all projects with filtering options.

### Filtering Tasks

Use the filter controls to narrow the list:
- **Phase** - Filter by phase number
- **Status** - Filter by task status (backlog, ready, in_progress, done, blocked)
- **Project** - Filter by project

### Task Status Workflow

1. **Backlog** → Task created, not ready for work
2. **Ready** → Task marked ready, available for Claude
3. **In Progress** → Claude is actively working on it
4. **Done** → Task completed successfully
5. **Blocked** → Task waiting on dependency or issue

### Mark Ready

For backlog tasks, use the **"Mark Ready"** button to make them available for Claude to execute.

### Inline Editing

Some fields can be edited inline:
- Status can be changed via dropdown
- Priority can be adjusted

### Sorting

Tasks are sorted by priority (ascending) then creation date.

fields.title: Task Intake Form
fields.description: Create new tasks for the project system.
fields.content:
## Task Intake

The Task Intake form is used to create new tasks that can be executed by Claude or completed manually.

### Required Fields

- **Title** - Clear, descriptive task name
- **Phase** - Which phase this task belongs to
- **Project** - Which project this task is part of

### Task Description (Executable Task Standard)

For AI-executable tasks, the description must follow this structure:

- **Objective** - What the task should accomplish
- **Inputs** - Required context or resources (can be empty)
- **Actions** - Step-by-step instructions (at least one required)
- **Output** - Expected deliverable or completion criteria

### Optional Fields

- **Priority** - 1 (highest) to 5 (lowest)
- **Category** - Type of work (development, documentation, etc.)
- **Effort** - Estimated complexity (quick, small, medium, large)

### Status

New tasks default to **Backlog** status. Mark them **Ready** when they should be available for Claude to execute.

### Tips

- Be specific in the Objective and Actions fields
- Include file paths and function names when relevant
- Describe the expected output clearly so completion can be verified

fields.title: Managing Project Phases
fields.content:
## Project Phases

Phases organize tasks into logical groups within a project.

### Phase Properties

- **Phase Number** - Numeric order (1, 2, 3...)
- **Name** - Descriptive name for the phase
- **Objective** - What this phase aims to accomplish
- **Status** - Current state (planned, active, complete)

### Phase Workflow

1. **Planned** - Phase is defined but work hasn't started
2. **Active** - Phase is currently being worked on
3. **Complete** - All tasks in the phase are done

### Creating a Phase

1. Click **"New Phase"** button.
2. Enter the **Phase Number** (determines order).
3. Enter a **Name** (e.g., 'Foundation', 'Core Features').
4. Describe the **Objective**.
5. Set initial **Status** (usually 'planned').
6. Click **Save**.

### Editing Phases

Click on a phase to edit its properties. Be careful changing phase numbers as this affects task organization.

### Deleting Phases

Phases with tasks cannot be deleted. First reassign or delete the tasks.

fields.title: Projects Operator Runbook
fields.description: Reference guide for operating the project system.
fields.content:
## Projects Operator Runbook

This runbook explains how to operate the WLJ Projects System.

### What the Projects System Is

A task management system where Claude AI executes development tasks based on structured descriptions.

### Daily Operating Workflow

1. **Review Ready Tasks** - Check what's queued for Claude
2. **Monitor In Progress** - Watch for tasks Claude is working on
3. **Verify Completions** - Review done tasks for accuracy
4. **Handle Blocked Tasks** - Resolve dependencies or issues
5. **Add New Tasks** - Use Task Intake for new work

### Task Status Meanings

| Status | Meaning |
|--------|--------|
| backlog | Not ready for work |
| ready | Available for Claude |
| in_progress | Currently being executed |
| done | Completed successfully |
| blocked | Waiting on something |

### When Execution Stops

Claude stops when:
- No ready tasks are available
- A task requires clarification
- A blocking issue is encountered
- Tests fail unexpectedly

### Golden Rules

1. Tasks must follow the Executable Task Standard
2. Only mark tasks Ready when they're truly ready
3. Review completed work promptly
4. Keep blocked tasks updated with reasons

fields.title: Site Configuration
fields.description: Configure site-wide settings from the Admin Console.
fields.content:
## Site Configuration

Configure branding, feature toggles, and system settings.

### Branding

- **Site Name** - Displayed in browser title bar
- **Tagline** - Shown on landing page
- **Logo** - Custom logo image (200x64 recommended)
- **Favicon** - Browser tab icon (32x32 PNG)

### Feature Toggles

- **Allow Registration** - Enable/disable new signups
- **Require Email Verification** - Force email confirmation
- **Faith Enabled by Default** - Default setting for new users

### Theme Settings

- **Default Theme** - Assigned to new users

### Footer & Legal

- **Footer Text** - Copyright message
- **Privacy Policy URL** - Link to privacy policy
- **Terms URL** - Link to terms of service

### Saving Changes

Click **Save** to apply changes. Some settings may be cached for up to 1 hour.

fields.title: Theme Management
fields.content:
## Theme Management

Themes control the app's visual appearance with customizable colors.

### Theme Properties

- **Slug** - Unique identifier (e.g., 'ocean-blue')
- **Name** - Display name shown to users
- **Description** - Brief description of the theme's feel

### Color Settings

Each theme has light and dark mode colors:

**Light Mode:**
- Primary, Secondary, Accent
- Text, Text Muted
- Background, Surface, Border

**Dark Mode:**
- Same properties with 'dark_' prefix

### Creating a Theme

1. Click **"Add Theme"**
2. Enter slug, name, and description
3. Set all color values (hex format, e.g., #6366f1)
4. Check **Is Active** to make available
5. Click **Save**

### Making a Theme Default

Check **Is Default** on the theme that should be assigned to new users. Only one theme can be default.

### Color Tips

- Use consistent color families
- Ensure text has good contrast with backgrounds
- Test in both light and dark modes

fields.title: User Management
fields.content:
## User Management

View and manage registered user accounts.

### User List

The user list shows:
- Email address
- Join date
- Last login
- Staff status
- Active status

### User Properties

- **Email** - User's login email
- **Is Staff** - Can access admin areas
- **Is Active** - Account is enabled
- **Is Superuser** - Full admin privileges

### Common Actions

- **View Profile** - See user details and activity
- **Edit** - Modify user settings
- **Deactivate** - Disable account without deleting
- **Make Staff** - Grant admin access

### Security Notes

- Only superusers can create other superusers
- Deactivating an account prevents login but preserves data
- Users can be reactivated at any time
